null.verse 11:62: Zij zeiden: "O Salih, gij waart onze hoop.
null.verse 11:63: Hij zeide: "O, mijn volk, zeg mij, als ik een duidelijk bewijs van mijn Heer heb ontvangen en Hij mij barmhartigheid heeft geschonken, wie zal mij dan naast God helpen als ik Hem niet gehoorzaam? Gij zult slechts tot mijn ondergang bijdragen.
null.verse 11:64: "En o, mijn volk, dit is de kamelin van God als teken voor u; laat haar daarom met rust opdat zij zich (in vrijheid) op God’s aarde moge voeden en doe haar geen kwaad, anders zal de eerste de beste straf u treffen.
null.verse 11:65: Maar zij verlamden haar; toen zeide hij (Salih): "Vermaakt u voor drie dagen in uw huizen.
null.verse 11:66: En toen Ons gebod kwam, redden Wij Salih en met hem de gelovigen door Onze barmhartigheid en Wij redden hen van de schande van die dag.
null.verse 11:67: De straf achterhaalde degenen die kwaad hadden gesticht en zij lagen uitgestrekt in hun huizen,
null.verse 11:68: Alsof zij er nooit in hadden gewoond.
null.verse 11:69: En voorzeker Onze boodschappers kwamen met blijde tijdingen tot Abraham.
null.verse 11:70: Maar toen hij zag dat hun handen er zich niet naar uitstrekten, vond bij hen vreemd en vreesde hen.
null.verse 11:71: En zijn vrouw stond er bij en verwonderde zich, waarop Wij haar de blijde tijding van de geboorte van Izaak gaven en na Izaak van Jacob.
null.verse 11:72: Zij zeide: "O wonder! Zal ik een kind baren nu ik een oude vrouw ben en deze mijn echtgenoot een oude man is? Dit is inderdaad iets wonderbaarlijks.
null.verse 11:73: Zij zeiden: "Verwonder je u over God’s gebod? De barmhartigheid van God en Zijn zegeningen zijn over u, o bewoners van dit huis.
null.verse 11:74: En toen de vrees Abraham verliet en de blijde tijding tot hem kwam, begon hij met ons over het volk van Lot te redetwisten.
null.verse 11:75: Abraham was inderdaad verdraagzaam, zachtmoedig en wendde zich dikwijls (tot God).
null.verse 11:76: "O Abraham, wend u hiervan af.
null.verse 11:77: En toen Onze boodschappers tot Lot kwamen was hij verdrietig en voelde zich bezwaard om hen en zeide: "Dit is een moeilijke dag.
null.verse 11:78: Zijn volk kwam haastig naar hem toe.
null.verse 11:79: Zij antwoordden: "Gij weet wel, dat wij geen recht hebben op uw dochters en gij weet ook, wat wij wensen.
null.verse 11:80: Hij zeide: "Ach, had ik slechts de macht u weerstand te kunnen bieden of tot een machtige steun toevlucht te nemen.
null.verse 11:81: Zij (de boodschappers) zeiden: "O Lot, Wij zijn de boodschappers van uw Heer, zij zullen u stellig niet bereiken.
null.verse 11:82: Toen Ons gebod kwam, keerden Wij die stad ondersteboven en Wij deden er brokken klei laag boven laag op regenen;
null.verse 11:83: Die volgens de verordening van uw Heer waren gemerkt.
null.verse 11:84: En tot Midian zeide hun broeder Shoaib: "O mijn volk, aanbid God.
null.verse 11:85: "En o, mijn volk, geef volle maat en juist gewicht met rechtvaardigheid en bedrieg de mensen niet met hun goederen noch sticht onheil op aarde.
null.verse 11:86: "Hetgeen God u heeft toebedeeld, is beter voor u als gij gelovigen zijt.
null.verse 11:87: Zij antwoordden: "O Shoaib, beveelt uw gebed, dat wij hetgeen onze vaderen aanbaden, zouden verlaten of dat wij zouden ophouden met ons eigendom te doen wat wij willen? U bent inderdaad verstandig, recht geleid.
null.verse 11:88: Hij zeide: "O mijn volk, wat meen je indien ik een duidelijk bewijs van mijn Heer heb en Hij mij een goede voorziening heeft geschonken? En ik wil niet, in tegenstelling tot u, mijzelf veroorloven, hetgeen ik u verbied.
null.verse 11:89: "O, mijn volk, laat vijandigheid jegens mij u niet er toe leiden, dat hetzelfde u overkome als hetgeen het volk van Noach of het volk van Hoed of het volk van Salih overkwam; en het volk van Lot is niet ver van u.
null.verse 11:90: "En zoek vergiffenis van uw Heer en bekeer u tot Hem.
null.verse 11:91: Zij antwoordden: "O, Shoaib, wij begrijpen niet veel van hetgeen gij zegt en wij zien voorzeker, dat gij zwak zijt tegenover ons.
null.verse 11:92: Hij zeide: "O, mijn volk, is mijn gezin waardiger bij u dan God? En gij hebt Hem als waardeloos verworpen.
null.verse 11:93: "En o, mijn volk, handel op uw wijze, ik handel op de mijne.
null.verse 11:94: En toen Ons gebod kwam, redden Wij Shoaib en met hem de gelovigen door Onze barmhartigheid en kastijding greep de onrechtvaardigen zodat zij uitgestrekt in hun huizen lagen,
null.verse 11:95: Alsof zij er nooit hadden gewoond.
null.verse 11:96: Wij zonden Mozes voorzeker met Onze tekenen en duidelijk gezag,
null.verse 11:97: Naar Pharao en zijn leiders, zij volgden het gebod van Pharao maar het gebod van Pharao was in het geheel niet verstandig.
null.verse 11:98: Hij zal op de Dag der Opstanding voor zijn volk uitgaan en hen naar het Vuur leiden.
null.verse 11:99: En er werd hun in dit leven en op de Dag der Opstanding een vloek opgelegd.
null.verse 11:100: Dit zijn de tijdingen over de steden die Wij u verhalen.
null.verse 11:101: En Wij deden hun geen onrecht maar zij deden zichzelf onrecht aan.
null.verse 11:102: Zo is de greep van uw Heer, wanneer Hij de steden grijpt, terwijl zij kwaad verrichten.
null.verse 11:103: Hierin is gewis een teken voor hem die de straf van het Hiernamaals vreest.
null.verse 11:104: En Wij stellen het slechts voor een bepaalde tijd uit.
null.verse 11:105: De dag, waarop het komt, zal geen ziel zonder Zijn toestemming spreken; dan zullen sommigen hunner ongelukkig en anderen gelukkig zijn.
null.verse 11:106: Degenen dan, die ongelukkig zullen zijn, zullen in het Vuur zijn waarin zij zullen zuchten en steunen;
null.verse 11:107: En er, zolang de Hemelen en de Aarde bestaan in vertoeven, met uitzondering van hetgeen uw Heer moge behagen.
null.verse 11:108: Maar degenen, die gelukkig zullen blijken te zijn, zullen in de Hemel vertoeven, zolang de Hemelen en de Aarde bestaan, met uitzondering van hetgeen uw Heer moge behagen, een gave, die niet zal worden afgesneden.
null.verse 11:109: Wees dus niet in twijfel, omtrent hetgeen deze mensen aanbidden: zij aanbidden slechts, zoals hun vaderen voorheen aanbaden en Wij zullen hun voorzeker hetgeen hen toekomt ten volle en onverminderd geven.
null.verse 11:110: En Wij gaven Mozes voorzeker het Boek, maar men werd er oneens over; en ware het niet door een woord dat reeds van uw Heer was uitgegaan de zaak zou voorzeker voor hen zijn beslist; en waarlijk zij zijn er in een verontrustende twijfel over.
null.verse 11:111: En uw Heer zal hen allen naar hun werken ten volle vergelden.
null.verse 11:112: Blijf daarom standvastig zoals u is bevolen en ook degenen, die zich met u hebben bekeerd en overtreedt de grenzen niet, want Hij ziet voorzeker, wat gij doet.
null.verse 11:113: En neig u niet tot de onrechtvaardigen, anders zal het Vuur ook u aanraken en gij zult naast God geen vrienden hebben noch zul je worden geholpen.
null.verse 11:114: Houd het gebed aan de twee uitersten van de dag en gedurende de eerste uren van de nacht.
null.verse 11:115: En wees standvastig, voorzeker, God doet het loon der rechtvaardigen niet verloren gaan.
null.verse 11:116: Waarom waren er onder de geslachten die vóór u waren dan geen verstandige mensen, die het verderf op aarde konden verhinderen op enkelen na, die Wij uit hun midden redden? Maar de onrechtvaardigen volgden datgene waarin hun overvloed werd verleend en zij waren schuldig.
null.verse 11:117: Uw Heer zal de steden niet onrechtvaardig vernietigen, terwijl de bewoners er van oprecht zijn.
null.verse 11:118: En indien uw Heer had gewild, zou Hij het mensdom voorzeker tot één volk hebben gemaakt, maar zij zullen blijven verschillen.
null.verse 11:119: Met uitzondering van degenen, die uw Heer barmhartigheid heeft betoond - hiervoor heeft Hij hen geschapen - maar het woord van uw Heer: "Voorwaar Ik zal de hel met djinn en mensen allen tezamen vullen," is vervuld.
null.verse 11:120: En de tijdingen der boodschappers verhalen Wij u om daardoor uw hart te versterken.
null.verse 11:121: En zeg tot degenen die niet geloven: "Handelt naar uw vermogen, wij handelen ook.
null.verse 11:122: "En wacht af, wij wachten ook.
null.verse 11:123: En aan God behoren de geheimen van de hemelen en de aarde en naar Hem zal het geheel worden teruggebracht.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:3: And (bidding you): Ask pardon of your Lord and turn to Him repentant.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:4: Unto Allah is your return, and He is Able to do all things.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:5: Lo! now they fold up their breasts that they may hide (their thoughts) from Him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:6: And there is not a beast in the earth but the sustenance thereof dependeth on Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:7: And He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in six Days - and His Throne was upon the water - that He might try you, which of you is best in conduct.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:8: And if We delay for them the doom until a reckoned time, they will surely say: What withholdeth it ? Verily on the day when it cometh unto them, it cannot be averted from them, and that which they derided will surround them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:9: And if we cause man to taste some mercy from Us and afterward withdraw it from him, lo! he is despairing, thankless.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:10: And if We cause him to taste grace after some misfortune that had befallen him, he saith: The ills have gone from me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:11: Save those who persevere and do good works.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:12: A likely thing, that thou wouldst forsake aught of that which hath been revealed unto thee, and that thy breast should be straitened for it, because they say: Why hath not a treasure been sent down for him, or an angel come with him ? Thou art but a warner, and Allah is in charge of all things.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:13: Or they say: He hath invented it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:14: And if they answer not your prayer, then know that it is revealed only in the knowledge of Allah; and that there is no God save Him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:15: Whoso desireth the life of the world and its pomp, We shall repay them their deeds herein, and therein they will not be wronged.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:16: Those are they for whom is naught in the Hereafter save the Fire.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:17: Is he (to be counted equal with them) who relieth on a clear proof from his Lord, and a witness from Him reciteth it, and before it was the Book of Moses, an example and a mercy ? Such believe therein, and whoso disbelieveth therein of the clans, the Fire is his appointed place.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:18: Who doeth greater wrong than he who inventeth a lie concerning Allah ? Such will be brought before their Lord, and the witnesses will say: These are they who lied concerning their Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:19: Who debar (men) from the way of Allah and would have it crooked, and who are disbelievers in the Hereafter.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:20: Such will not escape in the earth, nor have they any protecting friends beside Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:21: Such are they who have lost their souls, and that which they used to invent hath failed them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:22: Assuredly in the Hereafter they will be the greatest losers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:23: Lo! those who believe and do good works and humble themselves before their Lord: such are rightful owners of the Garden; they will abide therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:24: The similitude of the two parties is as the blind and the deaf and the seer and the hearer.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:25: And We sent Noah unto his folk (and he said): Lo! I am a plain warner unto you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:26: That ye serve none, save Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:27: The chieftains of his folk, who disbelieved, said: We see thee but a mortal like us, and we see not that any follow thee save the most abject among us, without reflection.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:28: He said: O my people! Bethink you, if I rely on a clear proof from my Lord and there hath come unto me a mercy from His presence, and it hath been made obscure to you, can we compel you to accept it when ye are averse thereto ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:29: And O my people! I ask of you no wealth therefor.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:30: And, O my people! who would deliver me from Allah if I thrust them away ? Will ye not then reflect ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:31: I say not unto you: "I have the treasures of Allah" nor "I have knowledge of the Unseen," nor say I: "Lo! I am an angel!" Nor say I unto those whom your eyes scorn that Allah will not give them good - Allah knoweth best what is in their hearts - Lo! then indeed I should be of the wrong-doers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:32: They said: O Noah! Thou hast disputed with us and multiplied disputation with us; now bring upon us that wherewith thou threatenest us, if thou art of the truthful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:33: He said: Only Allah will bring it upon you if He will, and ye can by no means escape.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:34: My counsel will not profit you if I were minded to advise you, if Allah’s will is to keep you astray.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:35: Or say they (again): He hath invented it ? Say: If I have invented it, upon me be my crimes, but I am innocent of (all) that ye commit.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:36: And it was inspired in Noah, (saying): No-one of thy folk will believe save him who hath believed already.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:37: Build the ship under Our eyes and by Our inspiration, and speak not unto Me on behalf of those who do wrong.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:38: And he was building the ship, and every time that chieftains of his people passed him, they made mock of him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:39: And ye shall know to whom a punishment that will confound him cometh, and upon whom a lasting doom will fall.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:40: (Thus it was) till, when Our commandment came to pass and the oven gushed forth water, We said: Load therein two of every kind, a pair (the male and female), and thy household, save him against whom the word hath gone forth already, and those who believe.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:41: And he said: Embark therein! In the name of Allah be its course and its mooring.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:42: And it sailed with them amid waves like mountains, and Noah cried unto his son - and he was standing aloof - O my son! Come ride with us, and be not with the disbelievers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:43: He said: I shall betake me to some mountain that will save me from the water.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:44: And it was said: O earth! Swallow thy water and, O sky! be cleared of clouds! And the water was made to subside.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:45: And Noah cried unto his Lord and said: My Lord! Lo! my son is of my household! Surely Thy promise is the truth and Thou are the Most Just of Judges.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:46: He said: O Noah! Lo! he is not of thy household; lo! he is of evil conduct, so ask not of Me that whereof thou hast no knowledge.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:47: He said: My Lord! Lo! in Thee do I seek refuge (from the sin) that I should ask of Thee that whereof I have no knowledge.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:48: It was said (unto him): O Noah! Go thou down (from the mountain) with peace from Us and blessings upon thee and some nations (that will spring) from those with thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:49: This is of the tidings of the Unseen which We inspire in thee (Muhammad).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:50: And unto (the tribe of) A’ad (We sent) their brother, Hud.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:51: O my people! I ask of you no reward for it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:52: And, O my people! Ask forgiveness of your Lord, then turn unto Him repentant; He will cause the sky to rain abundance on you and will add unto you strength to your strength.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:53: They said: O Hud! Thou hast brought us no clear proof and we are not going to forsake our gods on thy (mere) saying, and we are not believers in thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:54: We say naught save that one of our gods hath possessed thee in an evil way.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:56: Lo! I have put my trust in Allah, my Lord and your Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:57: And if ye turn away, still I have conveyed unto you that wherewith I was sent unto you, and my Lord will set in place of you a folk other than you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:58: And when Our commandment came to pass We saved Hud and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us; We saved them from a harsh doom.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:60: And a curse was made to follow them in the world and on the Day of Resurrection.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:61: And unto (the tribe of) Thamud (We sent) their brother Salih.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:62: They said: O Salih! Thou hast been among us hitherto as that wherein our hope was placed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:63: He said: O my people! Bethink you: if I am (acting) on clear proof from my Lord and there hath come unto me a mercy from Him, who will save me from Allah if I disobey Him ? Ye would add to me naught save perdition.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:64: O my people! This is the camel of Allah, a token unto you, so suffer her to feed in Allah’s earth, and touch her not with harm lest a near torment seize you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:65: But they hamstrung her, and then he said: Enjoy life in your dwelling-place three days! This is a threat that will not be belied.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:66: So, when Our commandment came to pass, We saved Salih, and those who believed with him, by a mercy from Us, from the ignominy of that day.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:67: And the (awful) Cry overtook those who did wrong, so that morning found them prostrate in their dwellings,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:68: As though they had not dwelt there.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:69: And Our messengers cam unto Abraham with good news.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:70: And when he saw their hands reached not to it, he mistrusted them and conceived a fear of them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:71: And his wife, standing by laughed when We gave her good tidings (of the birth) of Isaac, and, after Isaac, of Jacob.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:72: She said: Oh woe is me! Shall I bear a child when I am an old woman, and this my husband is an old man ? Lo! this is a strange thing!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:73: They said: Wonderest thou at the commandment of Allah ? The mercy of Allah and His blessings be upon you, O people of the house! Lo! He is Owner of Praise, Owner of Glory!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:74: And when the awe departed from Abraham, and the glad news reached him, he pleaded with Us on behalf of the folk of Lot.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:75: Lo! Abraham was mild, imploring, penitent.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:76: (It was said) O Abraham! Forsake this! Lo! thy Lord’s commandment hath gone forth, and lo! there cometh unto them a doom which cannot be repelled.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:77: And when Our messengers came unto Lot, he was distressed and knew not how to protect them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:78: And his people came unto him, running towards him - and before then they used to commit abominations - He said: O my people! Here are my daughters! They are purer for you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:79: They said: Well thou knowest that we have no right to thy daughters, and well thou knowest what we want.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:80: He said: Would that I had strength to resist you or had some strong support (among you)!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:81: (The messengers) said: O Lot! Lo! we are messengers of thy Lord; they shall not reach thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:82: So when Our commandment came to pass We overthrew (that township) and rained upon it stones of clay, one after another,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:83: Marked with fire in the providence of thy Lord (for the destruction of the wicked).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:84: And unto Midian (We sent) their brother Shu’eyb.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:85: O my people! Give full measure and full weight in justice, and wrong not people in respect of their goods.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:86: That which Allah leaveth with you is better for you if ye are believers; and I am not a keeper over you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:87: They said: O Shu’eyb! Doth thy way of prayer command thee that we should forsake that which our fathers (used to) worship, or that we (should leave off) doing what we will with our own property.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:88: He said: O my people! Bethink you: if I am (acting) on a clear proof from my Lord and He sustaineth me with fair sustenance from Him (how can I concede aught to you) ? I desire not to do behind your backs that which I ask you not to do.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:89: And, O my people! Let not the schism with me cause you to sin so that there befall you that which befell the folk of Noah and the folk of Hud, and the folk of Salih; and the folk of Lot are not far off from you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:90: Ask pardon of your Lord and then turn unto Him (repentant).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:91: They said: O Shu’eyb! We understand not much of that thou tellest, and lo! we do behold thee weak among us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:92: He said: O my people! Is my family more to be honoured by you than Allah ? and ye put Him behind you, neglected! Lo! my Lord surroundeth what ye do.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:93: And, O my people! Act according to your power, lo! I (too) am acting.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:94: And when Our commandment came to pass We saved Shu’eyb and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us; and the (Awful) Cry seized those who did injustice, and morning found them prostrate in their dwellings,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:95: As though they had not dwelt there.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:96: And verily We sent Moses with Our revelations and a clear warrant
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:97: Unto Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they did follow the command of Pharaoh, and the command of Pharaoh was no right guide.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:98: He will go before his people on the Day of Resurrection and will lead them to the Fire for watering-place.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:99: A curse is made to follow them in the world and on the Day of Resurrection.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:100: That is (something) of the tidings of the townships (which were destroyed of old).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:101: We wronged them not, but they did wrong themselves; and their gods on whom they call beside Allah availed them naught when came thy Lord’s command; they added to them naught save ruin.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:102: Even thus is the grasp of thy Lord when He graspeth the townships while they are doing wrong.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:103: Lo! herein verily there is a portent for those who fear the doom of the Hereafter.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:104: And We defer it only to a term already reckoned.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:105: On the day when it cometh no soul will speak except by His permission; some among them will be wretched, (others) glad.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:106: As for those who will be wretched (on that day) they will be in the Fire; sighing and wailing will be their portion therein,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:107: Abiding there so long as the heavens and the earth endure save for that which thy Lord willeth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:108: And as for those who will be glad (that day) they will be in the Garden, abiding there so long as the heavens and the earth endure save for that which thy Lord willeth: a gift unfailing.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:109: So be not thou in doubt concerning that which these (folk) worship.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:110: And we verily gave unto Moses the Scripture, and there was strife thereupon; and had it not been for a Word that had already gone forth from thy Lord, the case would have been judged between them, and lo! they are in grave doubt concerning it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:111: And lo! unto each thy Lord will verily repay his works in full.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:112: So tread thou the straight path as thou art commanded, and those who turn (unto Allah) with thee, and transgress not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:113: And incline not toward those who do wrong lest the Fire touch you, and ye have no protecting friends against Allah, and afterward ye would not be helped.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:114: Establish worship at the two ends of the day and in some watches of the night.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:115: And have patience, (O Muhammad), for lo! Allah loseth not the wages of the good.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:116: If only there had been among the generations before you men possessing a remnant (of good sense) to warn (their people) from corruption in the earth, as did a few of those whom We saved from them! The wrong-doers followed that by which they were made sapless, and were guilty.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:117: In truth thy Lord destroyed not the townships tyrannously while their folk were doing right.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:118: And if thy Lord had willed, He verily would have made mankind one nation, yet they cease not differing,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:119: Save him on whom thy Lord hath mercy; and for that He did create them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:120: And all that We relate unto thee of the story of the messengers is in order that thereby We may make firm thy heart.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:121: And say unto those who believe not: Act according to your power.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:122: And wait! Lo! We (too) are waiting.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 11:123: And Allah’s is the Invisible of the heavens and the earth, and unto Him the whole matter will be returned.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:2: (It teacheth) that ye should worship none but God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:3: "(And to preach thus), ’Seek ye the forgiveness of your Lord, and turn to Him in repentance; that He may grant you enjoyment, good (and true), for a term appointed, and bestow His abounding grace on all who abound in merit! But if ye turn away, then I fear for you the penalty of a great day:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:4: ’To God is your return, and He hath power over all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:5: Behold! they fold up their hearts, that they may lie hid from Him! Ah even when they cover themselves with their garments, He knoweth what they conceal, and what they reveal: for He knoweth well the (inmost secrets) of the hearts.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:6: There is no moving creature on earth but its sustenance dependeth on God: He knoweth the time and place of its definite abode and its temporary deposit: All is in a clear Record.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:7: He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in six Days - and His Throne was over the waters - that He might try you, which of you is best in conduct.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:8: If We delay the penalty for them for a definite term, they are sure to say, "What keeps it back?" Ah! On the day it (actually) reaches them, nothing will turn it away from them, and they will be completely encircled by that which they used to mock at!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:9: If We give man a taste of Mercy from Ourselves, and then withdraw it from him, behold! he is in despair and (falls into) blasphemy.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:10: But if We give him a taste of (Our) favours after adversity hath touched him, he is sure to say, "All evil has departed from me:" Behold! he falls into exultation and pride.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:11: Not so do those who show patience and constancy, and work righteousness; for them is forgiveness (of sins) and a great reward.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:12: Perchance thou mayest (feel the inclination) to give up a part of what is revealed unto thee, and thy heart feeleth straitened lest they say, "Why is not a treasure sent down unto him, or why does not an angel come down with him?" But thou art there only to warn! It is God that arrangeth all affairs!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:13: Or they may say, "He forged it," Say, "Bring ye then ten suras forged, like unto it, and call (to your aid) whomsoever ye can, other than God!- If ye speak the truth!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:14: "If then they (your false gods) answer not your (call), know ye that this revelation is sent down (replete) with the knowledge of God, and that there is no god but He! will ye even then submit (to Islam)?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:15: Those who desire the life of the present and its glitter,- to them we shall pay (the price of) their deeds therein,- without diminution.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:16: They are those for whom there is nothing in the Hereafter but the Fire: vain are the designs they frame therein, and of no effect and the deeds that they do!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:17: Can they be (like) those who accept a Clear (Sign) from their Lord, and whom a witness from Himself doth teach, as did the Book of Moses before it,- a guide and a mercy? They believe therein; but those of the Sects that reject it,- the Fire will be their promised meeting-place.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:18: Who doth more wrong than those who invent a life against God? They will be turned back to the presence of their Lord, and the witnesses will say, "These are the ones who lied against their Lord! Behold! the Curse of God is on those who do wrong!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:19: "Those who would hinder (men) from the path of God and would seek in it something crooked: these were they who denied the Hereafter!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:20: They will in no wise frustrate (His design) on earth, nor have they protectors besides God! Their penalty will be doubled! They lost the power to hear, and they did not see!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:21: They are the ones who have lost their own souls: and the (fancies) they invented have left them in the lurch!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:22: Without a doubt, these are the very ones who will lose most in the Hereafter!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:23: But those who believe and work righteousness, and humble themselves before their Lord,- They will be companions of the gardens, to dwell therein for aye!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:24: These two kinds (of men) may be compared to the blind and deaf, and those who can see and hear well.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:25: We sent Noah to his people (with a mission): "I have come to you with a Clear Warning:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:26: "That ye serve none but God: Verily I do fear for you the penalty of a grievous day.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:27: But the chiefs of the Unbelievers among his people said: "We see (in) thee nothing but a man like ourselves: Nor do we see that any follow thee but the meanest among us, in judgment immature: Nor do we see in you (all) any merit above us: in fact we thing ye are liars!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:28: He said: "O my people! See ye if (it be that) I have a Clear Sign from my Lord, and that He hath sent Mercy unto me from His own presence, but that the Mercy hath been obscured from your sight? shall we compel you to accept it when ye are averse to it?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:29: "And O my people! I ask you for no wealth in return: my reward is from none but God: But I will not drive away (in contempt) those who believe: for verily they are to meet their Lord, and ye I see are the ignorant ones!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:30: "And O my people! who would help me against God if I drove them away? Will ye not then take heed?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:31: "I tell you not that with me are the treasures of God, nor do I know what is hidden, nor claim I to be an angel.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:32: They said: "O Noah! thou hast disputed with us, and (much) hast thou prolonged the dispute with us: now bring upon us what thou threatenest us with, if thou speakest the truth!?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:33: He said: "Truly, God will bring it on you if He wills,- and then, ye will not be able to frustrate it!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:34: "Of no profit will be my counsel to you, much as I desire to give you (good) counsel, if it be that God willeth to leave you astray: He is your Lord! and to Him will ye return!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:35: Or do they say, "He has forged it"? Say: "If I had forged it, on me were my sin! and I am free of the sins of which ye are guilty!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:36: It was revealed to Noah: "None of thy people will believe except those who have believed already! So grieve no longer over their (evil) deeds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:37: "But construct an Ark under Our eyes and Our inspiration, and address Me no (further) on behalf of those who are in sin: for they are about to be overwhelmed (in the Flood).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:38: Forthwith he (starts) constructing the Ark: Every time that the chiefs of his people passed by him, they threw ridicule on him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:39: "But soon will ye know who it is on whom will descend a penalty that will cover them with shame,- on whom will be unloosed a penalty lasting:"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:40: At length, behold! there came Our command, and the fountains of the earth gushed forth! We said: "Embark therein, of each kind two, male and female, and your family - except those against whom the word has already gone forth,- and the Believers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:41: So he said: "Embark ye on the Ark, In the name of God, whether it move or be at rest! For my Lord is, be sure, Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:42: So the Ark floated with them on the waves (towering) like mountains, and Noah called out to his son, who had separated himself (from the rest): "O my son! embark with us, and be not with the unbelievers!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:43: The son replied: "I will betake myself to some mountain: it will save me from the water.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:44: Then the word went forth: "O earth! swallow up thy water, and O sky! Withhold (thy rain)!" and the water abated, and the matter was ended.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:45: And Noah called upon his Lord, and said: "O my Lord! surely my son is of my family! and Thy promise is true, and Thou art the justest of Judges!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:46: He said: "O Noah! He is not of thy family: For his conduct is unrighteous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:47: Noah said: "O my Lord! I do seek refuge with Thee, lest I ask Thee for that of which I have no knowledge.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:48: The word came: "O Noah! Come down (from the Ark) with peace from Us, and blessing on thee and on some of the peoples (who will spring) from those with thee: but (there will be other) peoples to whom We shall grant their pleasures (for a time), but in the end will a grievous penalty reach them from Us.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:49: Such are some of the stories of the unseen, which We have revealed unto thee: before this, neither thou nor thy people knew them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:50: To the ’Ad People (We sent) Hud, one of their own brethren.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:51: "O my people! I ask of you no reward for this (Message).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:52: "And O my people! Ask forgiveness of your Lord, and turn to Him (in repentance): He will send you the skies pouring abundant rain, and add strength to your strength: so turn ye not back in sin!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:53: They said: "O Hud! No Clear (Sign) that hast thou brought us, and we are not the ones to desert our gods on thy word! Nor shall we believe in thee!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:54: "We say nothing but that (perhaps) some of our gods may have seized thee with imbecility.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:55: "Other gods as partners! so scheme (your worst) against me, all of you, and give me no respite.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:56: "I put my trust in God, My Lord and your Lord! There is not a moving creature, but He hath grasp of its fore-lock.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:57: "If ye turn away,- I (at least) have conveyed the Message with which I was sent to you.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:58: So when Our decree issued, We saved Hud and those who believed with him, by (special) Grace from Ourselves: We saved them from a severe penalty.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:59: Such were the ’Ad People: they rejected the Signs of their Lord and Cherisher; disobeyed His apostles; And followed the command of every powerful, obstinate transgressor.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:60: And they were pursued by a Curse in this life,- and on the Day of Judgment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:61: To the Thamud People (We sent) Salih, one of their own brethren.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:62: They said: "O Salih! thou hast been of us! a centre of our hopes hitherto! dost thou (now) forbid us the worship of what our fathers worshipped? But we are really in suspicious (disquieting) doubt as to that to which thou invitest us.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:63: He said: "O my people! do ye see? if I have a Clear (Sign) from my Lord and He hath sent Mercy unto me from Himself,- who then can help me against God if I were to disobey Him? What then would ye add to my (portion) but perdition?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:64: "And O my people! This she-camel of God is a symbol to you: leave her to feed on God’s (free) earth, and inflict no harm on her, or a swift penalty will seize you!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:66: When Our Decree issued, We saved Salih and those who believed with him, by (special) Grace from Ourselves - and from the Ignominy of that day.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:67: The (mighty) Blast overtook the wrong-doers, and they lay prostrate in their homes before the morning,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:68: As if they had never dwelt and flourished there.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:69: There came Our messengers to Abraham with glad tidings.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:70: But when he saw their hands went not towards the (meal), he felt some mistrust of them, and conceived a fear of them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:71: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed: But we gave her glad tidings of Isaac, and after him, of Jacob.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:72: She said: "Alas for me! shall I bear a child, seeing I am an old woman, and my husband here is an old man? That would indeed be a wonderful thing!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:73: They said: "Dost thou wonder at God’s decree? The grace of God and His blessings on you, o ye people of the house! for He is indeed worthy of all praise, full of all glory!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:74: When fear had passed from (the mind of) Abraham and the glad tidings had reached him, he began to plead with us for Lut’s people.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:75: For Abraham was, without doubt, forbearing (of faults), compassionate, and given to look to God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:77: When Our messengers came to Lut, he was grieved on their account and felt himself powerless (to protect) them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:78: And his people came rushing towards him, and they had been long in the habit of practising abominations.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:79: They said: "Well dost thou know we have no need of thy daughters: indeed thou knowest quite well what we want!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:80: He said: "Would that I had power to suppress you or that I could betake myself to some powerful support.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:81: (The Messengers) said: "O Lut! We are Messengers from thy Lord! By no means shall they reach thee! now travel with thy family while yet a part of the night remains, and let not any of you look back: but thy wife (will remain behind): To her will happen what happens to the people.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:82: When Our Decree issued, We turned (the cities) upside down, and rained down on them brimstones hard as baked clay, spread, layer on layer,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:83: Marked as from thy Lord: Nor are they ever far from those who do wrong!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:84: To the Madyan People (We sent) Shu’aib, one of their own brethren: he said: "O my people! worship God: Ye have no other god but Him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:85: "And O my people! give just measure and weight, nor withhold from the people the things that are their due: commit not evil in the land with intent to do mischief.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:86: "That which is left you by God is best for you, if ye (but) believed! but I am not set over you to keep watch!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:87: They said: "O Shu’aib! Does thy (religion of) prayer command thee that we leave off the worship which our fathers practised, or that we leave off doing what we like with our property? truly, thou art the one that forbeareth with faults and is right-minded!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:88: He said: "O my people! see ye whether I have a Clear (Sign) from my Lord, and He hath given me sustenance (pure and) good as from Himself? I wish not, in opposition to you, to do that which I forbid you to do.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:89: "And O my people! let not my dissent (from you) cause you to sin, lest ye suffer a fate similar to that of the people of Noah or of Hud or of Salih, nor are the people of Lut far off from you!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:90: "But ask forgiveness of your Lord, and turn unto Him (in repentance): For my Lord is indeed full of mercy and loving-kindness.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:91: They said: "O Shu’aib! much of what thou sayest we do not understand! In fact among us we see that thou hast no strength! Were it not for thy family, we should certainly have stoned thee! for thou hast among us no great position!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:92: He said: "O my people! is then my family of more consideration with you than God? For ye cast Him away behind your backs (with contempt).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:93: "And O my people! Do whatever ye can: I will do (my part): Soon will ye know who it is on whom descends the penalty of ignominy; and who is a liar! and watch ye! for I too am watching with you!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:94: When Our decree issued, We saved Shu’aib and those who believed with him, by (special) mercy from Ourselves: But the (mighty) blast did seize the wrong-doers, and they lay prostrate in their homes by the morning,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:95: As if they had never dwelt and flourished there! Ah! Behold! How the Madyan were removed (from sight) as were removed the Thamud!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:96: And we sent Moses, with Our Clear (Signs) and an authority manifest,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:97: Unto Pharaoh and his chiefs: but they followed the command of Pharaoh and the command of Pharaoh was no right (guide).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:98: He will go before his people on the Day of Judgment, and lead them into the Fire (as cattle are led to water): But woeful indeed will be the place to which they are led!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:99: And they are followed by a curse in this (life) and on the Day of Judgment: and woeful is the gift which shall be given (unto them)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:100: These are some of the stories of communities which We relate unto thee: of them some are standing, and some have been mown down (by the sickle of time).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:101: It was not We that wronged them: They wronged their own souls: the deities, other than God, whom they invoked, profited them no whit when there issued the decree of thy Lord: Nor did they add aught (to their lot) but perdition!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:102: Such is the chastisement of thy Lord when He chastises communities in the midst of their wrong: grievous, indeed, and severe is His chastisement.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:103: In that is a Sign for those who fear the penalty of the Hereafter: that is a Day for which mankind will be gathered together: that will be a Day of Testimony.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:104: Nor shall We delay it but for a term appointed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:105: The day it arrives, no soul shall speak except by His leave: of those (gathered) some will be wretched and some will be blessed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:106: Those who are wretched shall be in the Fire: There will be for them therein (nothing but) the heaving of sighs and sobs:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:107: They will dwell therein for all the time that the heavens and the earth endure, except as thy Lord willeth: for thy Lord is the (sure) accomplisher of what He planneth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:108: And those who are blessed shall be in the Garden: They will dwell therein for all the time that the heavens and the earth endure, except as thy Lord willeth: a gift without break.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:109: Be not then in doubt as to what these men worship.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:110: We certainly gave the Book to Moses, but differences arose therein: had it not been that a word had gone forth before from thy Lord, the matter would have been decided between them, but they are in suspicious doubt concerning it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:111: And, of a surety, to all will your Lord pay back (in full the recompense) of their deeds: for He knoweth well all that they do.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:112: Therefore stand firm (in the straight Path) as thou art commanded,- thou and those who with thee turn (unto God); and transgress not (from the Path): for He seeth well all that ye do.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:113: And incline not to those who do wrong, or the Fire will seize you; and ye have no protectors other than God, nor shall ye be helped.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:114: And establish regular prayers at the two ends of the day and at the approaches of the night: For those things, that are good remove those that are evil: Be that the word of remembrance to those who remember (their Lord):
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:115: And be steadfast in patience; for verily God will not suffer the reward of the righteous to perish.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:116: Why were there not, among the generations before you, persons possessed of balanced good sense, prohibiting (men) from mischief in the earth - except a few among them whom We saved (from harm)? But the wrong-doers pursued the enjoyment of the good things of life which were given them, and persisted in sin.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:117: Nor would thy Lord be the One to destroy communities for a single wrong-doing, if its members were likely to mend.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:118: If thy Lord had so willed, He could have made mankind one people: but they will not cease to dispute.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:119: Except those on whom thy Lord hath bestowed His Mercy: and for this did He create them: and the Word of thy Lord shall be fulfilled: "I will fill Hell with jinns and men all together.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:120: All that we relate to thee of the stories of the apostles,- with it We make firm thy heart: in them there cometh to thee the Truth, as well as an exhortation and a message of remembrance to those who believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:121: Say to those who do not believe: "Do what ever ye can: We shall do our part;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:122: "And wait ye! We too shall wait.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 11:123: To God do belong the unseen (secrets) of the heavens and the earth, and to Him goeth back every affair (for decision): then worship Him, and put thy trust in Him: and thy Lord is not unmindful of aught that ye do.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:2: ’Serve you none but God’ (I am to you a warner from Him and a bearer of good tidings)
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:3: and: ’Ask forgiveness of your Lord, then repent to Him, and He will give you fair enjoyment unto a term stated, and He will give of His bounty to every man of grace.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:4: to God shall you return; He is powerful over everything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:5: Behold, they fold their breasts, to hide them from Him; behold, when they wrap themselves in their garments He knows what they secrete and what they publish; surely He knows all the thoughts within the breasts.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:6: No creature is there crawling on the earth, but its provision rests on God; He knows its lodging-place and its repository.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:7: And it is He who created the heavens and the earth in six days, and His Throne was upon the waters -- that He might try you, which one of you is fairer in works.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:8: And if We postpone the chastisement from them till a reckoned moment they will say ’What is detaining it?’ Surely, the day it shall come to them, it shall not be turned aside from them, and they shall be encompassed by that they mocked at.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:9: And if We let a man taste mercy from Us, and then We wrest it from him, he is desperate, ungrateful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:10: But if We let him taste prosperity after hardship that has visited him, he will say, ’The evils have gone from me’; behold, he is joyous, boastful --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:11: save such as are patient, and do deeds of righteousness; for them awaits forgiveness and a mighty wage.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:12: Perchance thou art leaving part of what is revealed to thee, and thy breast is straitened by it, because they say, ’Why has a treasure not been sent down upon him, or an angel not come with him?’ Thou art only a warner; and God is a Guardian over everything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:13: Or do they say, ’He has forged it’? Say: ’Then bring you ten suras the like of it, forged; and call upon whom you are able, apart from God, if you speak truly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:14: Then, if they do not answer you, know that it has been sent down with God’s knowledge, and that there is no god but He.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:15: Whoso desires the present life and its adornment, We will pay them in full for their works therein, and they shall not be defrauded there;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:16: those are they for whom in the world to come there is only the Fire; their deeds there will have failed, and void will be their works.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:17: And what of him who stands upon a clear sign from his Lord, and a witness from Him recites it, and before him is the Book of Moses for an ensample and a mercy? Those believe in it; but whosoever disbelieves in it, being one of the partisans, his promised land is the Fire.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:18: And who does greater evil than he who forges against God a lie? Those shall be presented before their Lord, and the witnesses will say, ’Those are they who lied against their Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:19: who bar from God’s way, desiring to make it crooked; they disbelieve in the world to come;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:20: they are unable to frustrate Him on earth and they have no protectors, apart from God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:21: Those are they that have lost their souls, and that they forged has gone astray from them;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:22: they without doubt will be the greatest losers in the world to come.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:23: But those who believe, and do righteous deeds, and have humbled themselves unto their Lord -- they shall be the inhabitants of Paradise, therein dwelling forever.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:24: The likeness of the two parties is as the man blind and deaf, and the man who sees and hears; are they equal in likeness? Will you not remember?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:25: And We sent Noah to his people: ’I am for you a warner, and a bearer of good tidings:
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:27: Said the Council of the unbelievers of his people, ’We see thee not other than a mortal like ourselves, and we see no? any following thee but the vilest of us, inconsiderately.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:28: He said, ’O my people, what think you? If I stand upon a clear sign from my Lord, and He has given me mercy from Him, and it has been obscured for you, shall we compel you to it while you are averse to it?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:29: O my people, I do not ask of you wealth for this; my wage falls only upon God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:30: O my people, who would help me against God, if I drive you away?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:31: Will you not remember? I do not say to you, "I possess the treasuries of God"; I know not the Unseen; and I do not say, "I am an angel.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:32: They said, ’Noah, thou hast disputed with us and make much disputation with us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:33: He said, ’God will bring you it if He will; you cannot frustrate Him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:34: And my sincere counsel will not profit you, if I desire to counsel you sincerely, if God desires to pervert you; He is your Lord, and unto Him you shall be returned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:35: (Or do they say, ’He has forged it’? Say: ’If I have forged it, upon me falls my sin; and I am quit of the sins you do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:36: And it was revealed to Noah, saying, ’None of thy people shall believe but he who has already believed; so be thou not distressed by that they may be doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:37: Make thou the Ark under Our eyes, and as We reveal; and address Me not concerning those who have done evil; they shall be drowned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:38: So he was making the Ark; and whenever a council of his people passed by him they scoffed at him, He said, ’If you scoff at us, we shall surely scoff at you, as you scoff
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:39: and you shall know to whom will come a chastisement degrading him, and upon whom there shall alight a lasting chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:40: Until, when Our command came, and the Oven boiled, We said, ’Embark in it two of every kind, and thy family -- except for him against whom the word has already been spoken and whosoever believes.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:41: He said, ’Embark in it! In God’s Name shall be its course and its berthing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:42: So it ran with them amid waves like mountains; and Noah called to his son, who was standing apart, ’Embark with us, my son, and be thou not with the unbelievers!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:43: He said, ’I will take refuge in a mountain, that shall defend me from the water.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:44: And it was said, ’Earth, swallow thy waters; and, heaven, abate!’ And the waters subsided, the affair was accomplished, and the Ark settled on El-Judi, and it was said: ’Away with the people of the evildoers!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:45: And Noah called unto his Lord, and said, ’O my Lord, my son is of my family, and Thy promise is surely the truth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:46: Said He, ’Noah, he is not of thy family; it is a deed not righteous.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:47: He said, ’My Lord, I take refuge with Thee, lest I should ask of Thee that whereof I have no knowledge; for if Thou forgivest me not, and hast not mercy on me, I shall be among the losers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:48: It was said, ’Noah, get thee down in peace from Us, and blessings upon thee and on the nations of those with thee; and nations -- We shall give them enjoyment, then there shall visit them from Us a painful chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:49: (That is of the tiding’s of the Unseen, that We reveal to thee; thou didst not know it, neither thy people, before this.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:50: And to Ad their brother Hood; he said, ’O my people, serve God! You have no god other than He; you are but forgers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:51: O my people, I do not ask of you a wage for this; my wage falls only upon Him who did originate me; will you not understand?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:52: And, O my people, ask forgiveness of your Lord, then repent to Him, and He will loose heaven in torrents upon you, and He will increase you in strength unto your strength; and turn not your backs as sinners.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:53: They said, ’Hood, thou hast not brought us a clear sign, and we will not leave our gods for what thou sayest; we do not believe thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:54: We say nothing, but that one of our gods has smitten thee with some evil.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:55: apart from Him; so try your guile on me, all together, then you shall give me no respite.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:56: Truly, I have put my trust in God, my Lord and your Lord; there is no creature that crawls, but He takes it by the forelock.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:57: But if you turn your backs, I have delivered to you that I was sent with unto you, and my Lord will make a people other than you successors; you will not hurt Him anything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:58: And when Our command came, We delivered Hood and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us, and delivered them from a harsh chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:59: That was Ad; they denied the signs of their Lord, and rebelled against His Messengers, and followed the command of every froward tyrant.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:60: And there was sent following after them in this world a curse, and upon the Day of Resurrection: ’Surely Ad disbelieved in their Lord: so away with Ad, the people of Hood!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:61: And to Thamood their brother Salih; he said, ’O my people, serve God! You have no god other than He.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:62: They said, ’Salih, thou hast hitherto been a source of hope among us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:63: He said, ’O my people, what think you? If I stand upon a clear sign from my Lord, and He has given me mercy from Him, who shall help me against God if I rebel against Him? You would do nothing for me, except increase my loss.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:64: O my people, this is the She-camel of God, to be a sign for you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:65: But they hamstrung her; and he said, ’Take your joy in your habitation three days -- that is a promise not to be belied.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:66: And when Our command came, We delivered Salih and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us, and from the degradation of that day; thy Lord is the All-strong, the All-mighty.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:67: And the evildoers were seized by the Cry, and morning found them in their habitations fallen prostrate
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:68: as if they never dwelt there: ’Surely Thamood disbelieved in their Lord, so away with Thamood!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:69: Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings; they said, ’Peace!’ ’Peace,’ he said; and presently he brought a roasted calf.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:70: And when he saw their hands not reaching towards it, he was suspicious of them and conceived a fear of them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:71: And his wife was standing by; she laughed, therefore We gave her the glad tidings of Isaac, and, after Isaac, of Jacob.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:72: She said, ’Woe is me! Shall I bear, being an old woman, and this my husband is an old man? This assuredly is a strange thing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:73: They said, ’What, dost thou marvel at God’s command? The mercy of God and His blessings be upon you, O people of the House! Surely He is All-laudable, All-glorious.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:74: So, when the awe departed from Abraham and the good tidings came to him, he was disputing with Us concerning the people of Lot;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:76: ’O Abraham, turn away from this; thy Lord’s command has surely come, and there is coming upon them a chastisement not to be turned back.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:77: And when Our messengers came to Lot, he was troubled on their account and distressed for them, and he said, ’This is a fierce day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:78: And his people came to him, running towards him; and erstwhile they had been doing evil deeds.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:79: They said, ’Thou knowest we have no right to thy daughters, and thou well knowest what we desire.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:80: He said, ’O would that I had power against you, or might take refuge in a strong pillar!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:81: They said, ’Lot, we are messengers of thy Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:82: So when Our command came, We turned it uppermost nethermost, and rained on it stones of baked clay, one on another,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:83: marked with thy Lord, and never far from the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:84: And to Midian their brother Shuaib; he said, ’O my people, serve God! You have no god other than He.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:85: O my people, fill up the measure and the balance justly, and do not diminish the goods of the people, and do not mischief in the land, working corruption.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:86: God’s remainder is better for you, if you are believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:87: They said, ’Shuaib, does thy prayer command thee that we should leave that our fathers served, or to do as we will with our goods? Thou art the clement one, the right-minded.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:88: He said, ’O my people, what think you? If I stand upon a clear sign from my Lord, and He has provided me with fair provision from Him -- and I desire not to come behind you, betaking me to that I forbid you; I desire only to set things right, so far as I am able.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:90: And ask forgiveness of your Lord, then repent to Him; surely my Lord is All-compassionate, All-loving.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:94: And when Our command came, We delivered Shuaib and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us, and the evildoers were seized by the Cry, and morning found them in their habitations fallen prostrate
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:95: as if they had never dwelt there: ’So away with Midian, even as Thamood was done away!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:96: And We sent Moses with Our signs, and a manifest authority,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:97: to Pharaoh and his Council; but they followed Pharaoh’s command, and Pharaoh’s command was not right-minded.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:98: He shall go before his people on the Day of Resurrection, and will have led them down to the Fire-evil the watering-place to be led down to!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:99: And there was sent following after them in this world a curse, and upon the Day of Resurrection -- evil the offering to be offered!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:100: That is of the tidings of the cities We relate to thee; some of them are standing and some stubble.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:101: And We wronged them not, but they wronged themselves; their gods availed them not that they called upon, apart from God, anything, when the command of thy Lord came; and they increased them not, save in destruction.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:102: Such is the seizing of thy Lord, when He seizes the cities that are evildoing; surely His seizing is painful, terrible.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:103: Surely in that is a sign for him who fears the chastisement in the world to come; that is a day mankind are to be gathered to, a day to witness,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:104: and We shall not postpone it, save to a term reckoned;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:105: the day it comes, no soul shall speak save by His leave; some of them shall be wretched and some happy.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:106: As for the wretched, they shall be in the Fire, wherein there shall be for them moaning and sighing, therein dwelling forever,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:107: so long as the heavens and earth abide, save as thy Lord will; surely thy Lord accomplishes what He desires.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:108: And as for the happy, they shall be in Paradise, therein dwelling forever, so long as the heavens and earth abide, save as thy Lord will -- for a gift unbroken.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:109: So be thou not in doubt concerning what these men serve; they serve only as their fathers served before; and We shall surely pay them in full their portion undiminished.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:110: And We gave Moses the Book; and there was difference regarding it, and but for a word that preceded from thy Lord, it had been decided between them; and they are in doubt of it disquieting.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:111: Surely each one of them -- thy Lord will pay them in full for their works; He is aware of the things they do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:112: So go thou straight, as thou hast been commanded, and whoso repents with thee; and be you not insolent; surely He sees the things you do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:113: And lean not on the evildoers, so that the Fire touches you -- you have no protectors apart from God -- and then you will not be helped.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:114: And perform the prayer at the two ends of the day and nigh of the night; surely the good deeds will drive away the evil deeds.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:115: And be thou patient; God will not leave to waste the wage of the good-doers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:116: Or if there had been, of the generations before you, men of a remainder forbidding corruption in the earth -- except a few of those whom We delivered of them; but the evildoers followed the ease they were given to exult in and became sinners.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:117: Yet thy Lord would never destroy the cities unjustly, while as yet their people were putting things right.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:118: Had thy Lord willed, He would have made mankind one nation; but they continue in their differences
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:119: excepting those on whom thy Lord has mercy.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:120: And all that We relate to thee of the tidings of the Messengers is that whereby We strengthen thy heart; in these there has come to thee the truth and an admonition, and a reminder to the believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:121: And say to the unbelievers: ’Act you according to your station; we are acting.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:122: And watch and wait; we are also watching and waiting.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 11:123: To God belongs the Unseen in the heavens and the earth.

Muhammad Asad.verse 11:163: seeing that they were pursued by
Muhammad Asad.verse 11:165: and [shall be finally overtaken by it] on the Day of Resurrection;
Muhammad Asad.verse 11:166: vile was the gift which they were given!
Muhammad Asad.verse 11:167: THIS ACCOUNT of the [fate of those ancient] communities – some of them still remaining, and some [extinct like] a field mown-down – We convey unto thee [as a lesson for mankind]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 11:168: for no wrong did We do to them, but it was they who wronged themselves.
Muhammad Asad.verse 11:169: And such is thy Sustainer’s punishing grasp whenever He takes to task any community that is given to evildoing: verily, His punishing grasp is grievous, severe!
Muhammad Asad.verse 11:170: Herein, behold, lies a message indeed for all who fear the suffering [which may befall them] in the life to come, [and are conscious of the coming of] that Day on which all mankind shall be gathered together – that Day [of Judgment] which shall be witnessed [by all that ever lived],
Muhammad Asad.verse 11:171: and which We shall not delay beyond a term set [by Us].
Muhammad Asad.verse 11:172: When that Day comes, not a soul will speak, unless it be by His leave; and of those [that are gathered together], some will be wretched and some, happy.
Muhammad Asad.verse 11:173: Now as for those who [by their deeds] will have brought wretchedness upon themselves, [they shall live] in the fire, where they will have [nothing but] moans and sobs [to relieve their pain],
Muhammad Asad.verse 11:174: therein to abide as long as the heavens and the earth endure – unless thy Sustainer wills it otherwise: for, verily, thy Sustainer is a sovereign doer of whatever He wills.
Muhammad Asad.verse 11:175: But as for those who [by virtue of their past deeds] will have been blest with happiness, [they shall live] in paradise, therein to abide as long as the heavens and the earth endure – unless thy Sustainer wills it otherwise – as a gift unceasing.
Muhammad Asad.verse 11:176: AND SO, [O Prophet,] be not in doubt about anything that those [misguided people] worship: they but
Muhammad Asad.verse 11:177: worship as their forefathers worshipped aforetime; and, behold, We shall most certainly give them their full due [for whatever good or evil they have earned], without diminishing aught thereof.
Muhammad Asad.verse 11:178: And, indeed, [similar was the case when] We vouchsafed the divine writ unto Moses, and some of his people set their own views against it; and had it not been for a decree that had already gone forth from thy Sustainer, judgment would indeed have been passed on them [then and there]: for, behold, they were in grave doubt, amounting to suspicion, about him [who called them unto God].
Muhammad Asad.verse 11:179: And, verily, unto each and all will thy Sustainer give their full due for whatever [good or evil] they may have done: behold, He is aware of all that they do!
Muhammad Asad.verse 11:180: Pursue, then, the right course, as thou hast been bidden [by God], together with all who, with thee, have turned unto Him; and let none of you behave in an overweening manner: for, verily, He sees all that you do.
Muhammad Asad.verse 11:181: And do not incline towards, nor rely upon, those who are bent on evildoing lest the fire [of the hereafter] touch you: for
