Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:2: (directing the Prophet to say to the people,) “You must not worship anyone other than Allah; I am for you a warner from Him, and a bearer of glad tidings;
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:3: and you must seek forgiveness from your Lord, then, turn to Him in repentance, and He will provide you with good things to enjoy for a given time, and bestow His extra favor on everyone who has extra good deeds (in his account).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:4: To Allah is your return, and He is powerful over everything.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:5: Beware, they bend their chests to hide from Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:6: There is no creature on earth whose sustenance is not undertaken by Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:7: He is the One who created the heavens and the earth in six days, while His throne was on water, so that He might test you as to who among you is better in deed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:8: And if We defer the punishment for them for a certain time, they will say, “What is holding it back?” Beware, the day it will visit them, it shall not be turned back from them, and they shall be besieged by what they used to ridicule.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:9: If We give man a taste of Our mercy and then take it away from him, he becomes highly desperate, utterly ungrateful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:10: And if We give him a taste of comfort after a hardship has touched him, he will say, “Evils have gone away from me”, (and thus) He will become over-exulting, boastful,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:11: except those who are patient and do good deeds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:12: Is it then possible from you (O Prophet,) that you will abandon some of what is being revealed to you, and that your heart will be straitened thereby, because they say, “Why has a treasure not been sent down to him or an angel not come with him?” You are but a warner.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:13: Do they say that he has fabricated it? Say (to them), “Then bring ten Sūrahs like this, fabricated.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:14: So, if they do not respond to your call, then be assured that it has been sent down with the knowledge of Allah and that there is no god but He.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:15: Those who seek (merely) the worldly life and its beauty, We will fully recompense them herein for their acts, and their right will not be curtailed in this world.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:16: Those are the people for whom there is nothing in the Hereafter except fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:17: Then, can such people be equal to the one who has a clear proof from his Lord, followed by an evidence from within, and before which there was the Book of Mūsā, a guide and a mercy? Such people believe in it; and whoever of the groups denies its veracity, his promised place is the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:18: Who is more unjust than the one who forges a lie against Allah? Such people will be presented before their Lord, and the witnesses will say, “These are the ones who lied against their Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:19: the ones who prevent (people) from the way of Allah and seek crookedness in it, and who are deniers of the Hereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:20: They were unable to frustrate (Allah’s plan) on the earth, and they had no supporters besides Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:21: Those are the ones who brought loss to their own selves, and all that they used to fabricate vanished from them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:22: Essentially, they are the worst losers in the Hereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:23: Surely, those who believe and do good deeds and humble themselves before their Lord, those are the people of Paradise.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:24: The example of the two groups is that of a blind and deaf person on the one hand, and a seeing and hearing one on the other.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:25: We sent NūH to his people (saying to them): “I am here to warn you
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:26: that you should worship none but Allah, (otherwise) I fear for you the punishment of a painful day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:27: So the chiefs of his people who disbelieved replied, “We are not seeing that you are anything more than a man like us, and we are not seeing that any people have followed you except those who are the meanest among us, and we have not seen in you people any superiority over us; rather, we believe that you are liars.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:28: He said, “O my people, tell me, if I am on a clear path from my Lord, and He has bestowed mercy upon me from Himself which is hidden from your sight, shall we, then, impose it upon you by force, while you are averse to it?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:29: And, O my people, I do not demand from you any wealth for it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:30: O my people, who would help me against (the punishment of) Allah, if I were to drive them away? Would you still take no lesson?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:31: And I do not say to you that I have the treasures of Allah, nor that I have the knowledge of the unseen, nor do I say that I am an angel.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:32: They said, “O NūH, you have debated with us, and debated too much.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:33: He said, “Only Allah will bring it to you, if He so wills, and you cannot frustrate (His will).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:34: My good counsel will not profit you, even though I wish you the best, if Allah wills to let you go astray.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:35: Do they (the pagans of Makkah) still say that he (Muhammad) has forged it? Say, “If I have forged it, then, I am responsible for my sin, and I am free of the sins you commit.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:36: And it was revealed to NūH: None of your people would come to believe any more, except those who have already believed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:37: And make an ark under Our eyes and according to Our revelation; and do not speak to Me about those who have crossed the limits, as they are destined to be drowned.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:39: So, you shall soon know who will be visited by a scourge that will humiliate him, and upon whom a lasting punishment will settle forever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:40: At last, when Our command came and the oven overflowed, We said, “Take into the Ark a pair of two from every species, along with your family,-except those against whom the Word has already been pronounced-and (also take into it) those who have believed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:42: And it was sailing with them amidst the waves like mountains.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:43: He said, “I shall take shelter on a mountain which will save me from the water.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:44: It was said (by Allah), “O earth, suck in your water, and O heaven, stop.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:45: NūH called unto his Lord and said, “My Lord, my son is a part of my family, and surely Your promise is true, and You are the greatest of all judges.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:46: He said, “O NūH, in fact, he is not a part of your family.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:47: He said, “My Lord, I seek refuge with You that I should ask You something of which I have no knowledge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:48: It was said, “O NūH, disembark in peace from Us and with blessings upon you and upon the peoples (springing) from those with you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:49: These are some reports from the unseen (events), which We reveal to you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:50: And to ‘Ād, (We sent) their brother Hūd.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:51: O my people, I ask you no reward for it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:52: O my people, seek forgiveness from your Lord, then turn to Him in repentance, and He will release the heavens pouring upon you, and will add strength to your strength, and do not turn away like sinners.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:53: They said, “O Hūd, you did not bring to us any proof, and we are not to leave our gods on your statement, and we are not to believe in you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:54: We do not say except that some of our gods have subjected you to some evil.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:56: I place my trust in Allah who is my Lord and your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:57: Now, if you turn away, I have already conveyed to you the message with which I was sent to you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:58: So, when came Our command, We saved Hūd and those who believed along with him, out of mercy from Us, and We did save them from a heavy punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:59: Such was the tribe of ‘Ād who rejected the signs of their Lord, disobeyed their Messengers and followed the dictates of every obstinate tyrant!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:60: A curse was made to pursue them in this world and on the Day of Judgment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:61: And to (the people of) Thamūd (We sent) their brother, SāliH.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:62: They said, “O SāliH, we had hopes in you before this.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:63: He said, “O my people, tell me: If I have a clear proof from my Lord, and He has bestowed mercy upon me from Himself, who will come to my help against Allah, if I still disobey Him? So, you extend nothing to me but loss.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:64: And O my people, this is the she-camel of Allah, a sign for you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:66: So, when came Our command, We saved SāliH and those who believed along with Him, out of mercy from Us, and (We saved them) from the disgrace of that day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:67: And those who transgressed were caught by the Cry, and they were found dead in their homes, fallen on their knees,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:68: as though they had never lived there.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:69: And Our emissaries came to Ibrāhīm with the good news.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:70: So, when he noticed their hands not acceding to it, he found them strange and felt scared of them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:71: His wife was standing (nearby), and she laughed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:72: She said, “Woe to me! Shall I give birth to a child while I am an old woman and this is my husband, an old man? This is something amazing indeed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:73: They said, “Do you marvel at Allah’s command? Allah’s mercy and His blessings have always been upon you, O people of the house.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:74: So, when fear left Ibrāhīm and the happy news came to him, he started disputing with Us for the people of LūT.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:75: Surely, Ibrāhīm is forbearing, very penitent, ever-turning to Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:77: When Our emissaries (angels) came to LūT, he was saddened because of them, and his heart felt uneasy for their sake, and He said, “This is a very hard day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:78: And his people came to him, rushing upon him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:79: They said, “You know that we have no claim on your daughters, and you know well what we want.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:80: He said, “Would that I had some power over you, or could seek refuge in a strong support!”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:81: They (the angels) said, “O LūT, we are emissaries of your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:82: So, when Our command came to pass, We turned their habitations upside down, and rained on it stones of hard clay, one over another
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:84: And to Madyan (We sent) their brother, Shu‘aib.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:85: And O my people, perfect the measure and the balance with justice and do not make the people short of their things, and do not go about the earth spreading disorder.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:86: Whatever is allowed by Allah to retain (lawfully) is better for you, if you are believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:87: They said, “O Shu‘aib, does your Salāh (prayer) command you that we should forsake what our fathers used to worship or that we should not deal with our wealth as we please? You pretend to be the only man of wisdom and guidance.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:88: He said, “O my people, tell me, if I am on a clear path from my Lord and He has provided me with a good provision from Himself, (should I still leave you unguided?) I do not want to do in your absence what I forbid you from.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:89: O my people, let not your hostility towards me cause you to suffer what was suffered by the people of NūH, or the people of Hūd, or the people of SāliH.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:90: Seek forgiveness from your Lord, then turn towards Him in repentance.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:91: They said, “O Shu‘aib, we do not understand much of what you say, and, in fact, we see you are weak among us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:92: He said, “O my people, is my clan more respectable to you than Allah, as you have taken Him as something thrown behind your backs? Surely, my Lord encompasses all that you do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:93: O my people, do what you can, I am to do (what I can).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:94: And when Our command came, We saved Shu‘aib and those who believed along with him, out of mercy from Us; and those who transgressed were caught by the Cry, and they were found (dead) in their homes, fallen on their knees
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:95: as though they never lived there.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:96: And We sent Mūsā, with Our signs and with clear proof,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:98: He will lead his people on the Day of Judgement, and make them descend into the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:99: The curse was made to pursue them here and on the Day of Judgement.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:100: That is a part of stories of the towns that We narrate to you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:101: We did no wrong to them; rather, they have wronged themselves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:102: Such is the seizing of your Lord when He seizes the (people of) towns when they are transgressing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:103: In this there is a sign for the one who fears the punishment of the Hereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:104: We do not defer it but for a limited term.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:105: The day it comes no one shall speak except by His leave.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:106: As for those who are wretched, they shall be in the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:107: They shall remain there forever, as long as the heavens and the earth remain intact, unless your Lord wills (otherwise).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:108: As for those who are blessed, they shall be in Paradise living there forever, as long as the heavens and the earth remain intact, unless your Lord wills (otherwise), It will be an award never to be ceased.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:109: So, be not in doubt about what they worship.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:110: And We gave Mūsā the Book, then it was disputed about.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:111: And to all of them, your Lord shall pay for their deeds in full.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:112: So, stand firm (on faith) as you have been commanded, as well as those who having repented (from disbelief) have joined you, and do not cross the limits.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:113: And do not incline towards the wrongdoers, lest the Fire should catch you, and you have no supporters other than Allah, then you should not be helped.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:114: Establish Salāh at both ends of the day, and in the early hours of the night.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:115: And be patient, for Allah does not let the reward of the righteous go to waste.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:116: Then, why is it that there were no people, among the generations before you, who would have enough remnants of wisdom to stop others from creating disorder in the land, except a few among them whom We saved (from Our punishment)? And the wrongdoers pursued the luxuries they were involved in, and they became sinners.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:117: Your Lord is not such that He would destroy the towns unjustly while their people are good in their ways.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:118: Had your Lord willed, He would have made all the people a single community.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:119: except those whom Allah has blessed with mercy, and for that He has created them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:120: We narrate to you all such stories from the events of the messengers as We strengthen your heart therewith.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:121: Say to those who do not believe, “Do whatever you can.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 11:123: To Allah belong the secrets of the heavens and the earth, and to Him the entire matter shall be returned.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:1: Alif lām rā’: [This is] a Book whose verses have been set out clearly, and then detailed from One Wise, Informed,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:4: And [bidding you]: 'Ask forgiveness of your Lord, then repent to Him, and He will give you fair enjoyment until a time appointed, and He will give every person of merit, [the due for] his merit.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:5: Unto God is your return, and He has power over all things'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:6: Lo! they fold up their breasts that they may hide from Him; lo! the moment they cover themselves with their garments, He knows what they keep hidden and what they proclaim.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:7: And there is not a creature in the earth but the sustenance thereof rests on God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:8: And He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in six days - and His Throne was upon the water - that He might try you, which of you is best in conduct.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:9: And if we postpone the chastisement for them until a reckoned time, they will surely say, 'What is detaining it?' Verily on the day when it comes to them, it cannot be averted from them, and that which they derided shall surround them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:10: And if We cause man to taste some mercy from Us, and then wrest it from him, lo! he is despairing, ungrateful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:11: But if We cause him to taste prosperity after some misery that had befallen him, assuredly he will say, 'The ills have gone from me'; lo! he is exultant, boastful;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:13: and perform righteous deeds; theirs will be forgiveness and a great reward.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:14: Perhaps, you might [think to] leave out some of what is revealed to you, and that your breast should be straitened by it, because they say, 'Why has a treasure not been sent down for him, or an angel not come with him?' You are but a warner, and God is Guardian over all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:15: Or do they say, ‘He has invented it?’ Say: ‘Then bring ten sūras the like thereof, invented, and call upon whom you can beside God if you are truthful’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:16: Then, if they do not answer you, know that it has been revealed only in God's knowledge, and that there is no god save Him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:17: He who desires the life of this world and its adornment - We shall repay them their deeds in it, and therein they shall not be defrauded.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:18: Those are they for whom there is nothing in the Hereafter but the Fire; what they contrive will have failed therein, and useless is that which they used to do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:19: Is he who relies on a clear proof from his Lord - [a clear proof] which is followed by a witness from Him, and before it was the Book of Moses as an example and a mercy? Those they believe in it; but he who disbelieves in it of the partisans, the Fire shall be his appointed place.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:20: And who does greater wrong than he who invents a lie concerning God? Those, they shall be brought before their Lord and the witnesses will say: 'These are they who lied concerning their Lord'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:22: from God's way, desiring [to have] it crooked; and in the Hereafter they are disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:23: Such will not escape in the earth and, beside God they
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:25: Such are they who have lost their souls, and that which they used to invent, has failed them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:26: Without doubt they will be the greatest losers in the Hereafter.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:27: Truly those who believe and perform righteous deeds and humble themselves before their Lord: such will be the inhabitants of Paradise, abiding therein.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:28: The likeness of the two parties is as the blind and the deaf and the one who sees and the one who hears are they equal in likeness? Will you not then remember?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:29: And verily We sent Noah to his people [and he said]: 'I am for you a clear warner.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:31: The council of his people who disbelieved, said: 'We see you but a mortal like us, and we see not that any follow you save the vilest among us,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:33: He said, 'O my people, have you considered if I am
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:34: upon a clear proof from my Lord and He has given me mercy from Him, and it has been obscured from you, can we compel you to it, while you are averse to it?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:35: And O my people, I do not ask of you any wealth for this.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:36: And O my people, who would help me against God if I drive them away? Will you not then remember?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:37: And I do not say to you, “I possess the treasure houses of God” nor, “I have knowledge of the Unseen”; nor do I say, “I am an angel”.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:38: They said, 'O Noah, you have disputed with us and disputed with us at length, so bring upon us that wherewith you are threatening us if you are of the truthful'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:39: He said, 'Only God will bring it upon you, if He wills; and you cannot escape Him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:40: And my counsel will not benefit you if I desire to counsel you when God desires to keep you astray.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:41: Or do they say, 'He has invented it'? Say: 'If I have invented it, then my crime will be upon me; and I am innocent of what you commit'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:42: And it was revealed to Noah that: 'None of your people will believe except he who has already believed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:43: Build the Ark under Our eyes and by Our inspiration, and do not address Me concerning those who have done evil; lo! they shall be drowned'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:44: And he was building the Ark and whenever a council of his people passed him, they scoffed at him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:45: and you shall know to whom will come a chastisement degrading him, and upon whom an enduring chastisement will fall'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:46: Such that when Our command came and the oven gushed forth, We said, 'Load therein of every kind two, and your family save those against whom the Word has already gone forth, and those who believe'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:47: And he said, 'Embark therein! In the Name of God be its course and its mooring.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:48: And it sailed with them amid waves like mountains, and Noah called out to his son, who was standing away, 'O my son, embark with us and do not be with the disbelievers!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:49: He said, 'I shall take refuge in a mountain that will protect me from the water.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:50: And it was said, ‘O earth, swallow your waters, and O heaven, abate!’ And the waters subsided.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:51: And Noah called out to his Lord and said, 'My Lord, lo! my son is of my family, and truly Your promise is the Truth, and You are the Most Just of Judges'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:52: He said: 'O Noah, lo! he is not of your family; lo! it is not a righteous deed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:53: He said, 'My Lord, I seek refuge in You that I should ask of You that whereof I have no knowledge.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:54: It was said, 'O Noah, go down in peace from Us and blessings upon you and upon some communities [that will spring] from those with you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:55: Those are of the tidings of the Unseen, which We inspire in you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:57: O my people, I do not ask of you any wage for it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:58: And, O my people, ask forgiveness of your Lord, then turn to Him repentant; He will release the sky upon you in abundance, and He will add to you strength to your strength.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:59: They said, ‘O Hūd, you have not brought us any clear proof, and we are not going to forsake our gods on [the basis of] your saying, and we are not believers in you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:60: We say nothing, save that one of our gods has possessed you in some evil way'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:61: beside Him; so plot against me all together, then give me no respite.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:62: Truly I have put my trust in God, my Lord and your Lord; there is no creature, but He takes it by the forelock.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:63: And if you turn away, still I have conveyed to you that wherewith I was sent to you, and my Lord will set in place of you a folk other than you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:64: And when Our command came to pass We delivered Hūd and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us, and We delivered them from a harsh chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:65: And that was ‘ād: they knowingly denied the signs of their Lord and disobeyed His messengers; and they followed the command of every rebellious tyrant.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:66: And a curse was made to follow them in this world and on the Day of Resurrection.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:67: And to Thamūd, their brother Sālih.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:68: They said, ‘O Sālih, you had been one of promise among us before this.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:69: He said, 'O my people, have you considered: if I am
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:70: upon a clear proof from my Lord, and He has given me from Him mercy, who will help me against God if I disobey Him? You would only be adding to my loss.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:71: And, O my people, this is the she-camel of God, a sign for you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:72: But they hamstrung her, and he said, 'Enjoy
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:73: in your dwellings for three days.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:74: So, when Our command came, We delivered Sālih and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us, and from the ignominy of that day.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:75: And those who did evil were seized by the Cry, so that they ended up lying lifeless prostrate in their habitations,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:76: as if they had not dwelt there: ‘Lo! Thamūd disbelieved in their Lord, lo! away with Thamūd!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:77: And verily Our messengers came to Abraham with good tidings.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:78: And when he saw their hands not reaching to it, he was suspicious of them and conceived a fear of them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:79: And his wife, standing by, laughed; and so We gave her the good tiding of Isaac, and, after Isaac, of Jacob.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:80: She said, 'Woe to me! Shall I bear a child when I am an old woman, and this my husband is an old man? Truly this is a strange thing'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:81: They said, 'Are you astonished by God's command? The mercy of God and His blessings be upon you, people of the House! Truly He is Praised, Glorious!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:82: And when the awe departed from Abraham and the good tiding came to him, he began to plead with Us concerning the people of Lot.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:83: Assuredly Abraham was forbearing, imploring, penitent.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:85: And when Our messengers came to Lot, he was distressed, and felt constrained in his power to protect them, and he said, 'This is a distressful day'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:86: And his people came to him, running towards him - and previously they had been committing abominations.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:87: They said, 'You know full well that we have no right to your daughters, and you know well what we desire'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:88: He said, 'Would that I had strength to resist you or could resort to some strong support!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:89: They said, 'O Lot, truly we are messengers of your Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:90: the morning: is the morning not nigh ?'

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:92: marked with your Lord, and they are not far from the evildoers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:93: And to Midian their brother Shu‘ayb.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:94: O my people, give full measure and weight in justice, and do not defraud people in respect of their goods, and do not be degenerate in the land, working corruption.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:95: The remainder [which is] from God is better for you if you are believers; and I am not a guardian over you'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:96: They said: ‘O Shu‘ayb, does your [way of] prayer command you that we should leave what our fathers [used to] worship, or to do as we will with our goods? You are indeed the forbearing, the right-guided’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:97: He said, 'O my people, have you considered that I might be
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:98: upon a clear proof from my Lord and that He has provided me with fair sustenance from Him? And I do not desire to be inconsistent in what I forbid you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:99: And, O my people, let not the breach with me make you deserve that there befall you the like of what befell the people of Noah, or the people of Hūd, or the people of Sālih, and the people of Lot are not far away from you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:100: And ask forgiveness of your Lord, then repent to Him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:101: They said: ‘O Shu‘ayb, we do not understand much of what you say.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:102: He said, 'O my people, is my clan more venerable in your sight than God? And do you put Him behind you, neglected? Truly my Lord encompasses what you do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:103: And, O my people, act according to your ability, lo! I
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:105: And when Our command came, We delivered Shu‘ayb and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us; and the Cry seized those who were evildoers and they ended up lying lifeless prostrate in their habitations,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:106: as if they had never dwelt there: ‘Lo! Away with Midian, just as Thamūd was done away with!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:107: And verily We sent Moses with Our signs and a clear warrant,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:108: to Pharaoh and his council; but they followed Pharaoh's command, and Pharaoh's command was not right-guided.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:109: He will go before his people on the Day of Resurrection, and he will lead them to the Fire - an evil place for those entering it!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:110: And a curse was made to follow them in this ,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:111: as well as on the Day of Resurrection - evil is the assistance offered!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:113: of the tidings of the towns, which We relate to you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:114: And We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:115: upon whom they called besides God, when the command of your Lord came; and they [their gods] did not increase them in anything but ruin.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:116: Such is the seizing of your Lord when He seizes the towns while they are doing wrong.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:117: There is indeed in that a sign for him who fears the chastisement of the Hereafter: that is a day to which mankind will be gathered, and that is a day witnessed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:118: And We do not defer it but to a term
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:120: The day it comes, no soul shall speak except by His permission.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:122: As for those who are damned, they will be in the Fire; their lot therein will be wailing and sighing;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:123: abiding therein for as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your Lord may will.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:124: And as for those who are fortunate they shall be in Paradise, abiding therein for as long as the heavens and the earth endure except what your Lord may will, an endless bounty.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:125: So do not be in doubt concerning what these
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:127: And We verily gave Moses the Scripture, but differences arose concerning it; and were it not for a word that went forth from your Lord, the case would have been decided between them; and truly they are in grave doubt concerning it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:128: And assuredly to each, verily your Lord will pay for his works in full.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:129: So remain upright as you have been commanded, and he who repents with you; and do not transgress.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:130: And do not incline toward the evildoers, lest the Fire touch you, and you have, besides God, no protectors; and then you will not be helped.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:131: And establish prayer at the two ends of the day, and in some watches of the night.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:132: And be patient, for indeed God does not waste the wage of those who are virtuous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:133: If only there had been among the generations before you men possessing a remnant [of good sense], forbidding corruption in the earth, except a few of those whom We delivered from among them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:134: Yet your Lord would never destroy the towns through injustice, while their inhabitants were righteous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:135: Had your Lord willed, He would have made mankind one community, but they continue to differ,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:136: except those on whom your Lord has mercy; and that is why He created them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:137: And all that We relate to you of the accounts of the messengers, that with which We might strengthen your heart.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:138: And say to those who do not believe: ’Act according to your ability, we are acting.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:139: And wait, we are also waiting’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 11:140: And to God belongs the Unseen of the heavens and the earth, and to Him all matters are returned.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:2: That do not worship anyone but Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:3: And that you should seek forgiveness from your Lord, then repent before Him (with true hearts).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:4: You are to return to Allah and He has mighty control over everything.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:5: Bear in mind! These (disbelievers) fold up their breasts so that they may hide (the state of their hearts) from Him (Allah).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:6: And there is no moving creature (living being) on the earth but (that) its sustenance is (a bountiful obligation) upon Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:7: And He (Allah) is the One Who created the heavens and the earth (the higher and the lower strata of the universe) in six days (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:8: And if We defer their torment for a few fixed days, they will definitely say: ‘What has held it back?’ Beware! The day when that (torment) comes upon them, (then) that will not be averted from them, and that (chastisement) which they used to make fun of will beset them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:9: And if We make man taste mercy from Us, then withdraw it from him (for some reason), he becomes highly disappointed (and) ungrateful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:10: And if We make him taste (some) favour after the suffering that afflicted him, then he is sure to say: ‘Gone are all my troubles.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:11: Except for those who remain steadfast and continue doing pious deeds.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:12: How may it be that you omit a portion of what has been revealed to you, and that your (sanctified) breast feels straitened (by the idea that) the disbelievers say: ‘Why has any treasure not been sent down to him (the Messenger [blessings and peace be upon him]), or why has any angel not come with him’? (O Glorious Messenger! That is impossible.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:13: Do the disbelievers say: ‘The Messenger has fabricated this (Qur’an) himself’? Say: ‘Bring then ten forged Chapters like this, and call (to your help) whom you can except Allah if you are truthful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:14: (O Muslims!) So, if they do not accept your challenge, then firmly believe that the Qur’an has been revealed with Allah’s knowledge, and that there is no other God but He.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:15: Those who lust after the worldly life (only) with its beauty (and embellishment), We pay them back in full for their works here in this world, and their (worldly recompense) is not diminished in the least.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:16: They are the people for whom there is no (share) in the Hereafter except the Fire (of Hell).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:17: He who holds fast to a clear proof from his Lord, and a testimony (the Qur’an) too has come from his Lord for his strength and support, and prior to that the Book of Musa (,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:18: the Torah), a guide and a mercy (too had come)—so, it is they who believe in it (the Qur’an).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:19: And who can be a greater wrongdoer than the one who fabricates a lie against Allah? Such people will be brought before their Lord and the witnesses will say: ‘These are the ones who foisted a lie upon their Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:20: Those who hinder (others) from the path of Allah and look for crookedness in it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:21: They have no capability at all to frustrate (Allah) on earth, nor are there any helpers for them apart from Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:22: It is they who ruined their souls, and the lies they used to invent are (all) gone from them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:23: This is absolutely true that it is certainly they who will be the greatest losers in the Hereafter.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:24: Verily, those who believe and persist in pious works and humble themselves before their Lord, it is they who are the people of Paradise.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:25: The example of the two parties (the disbelievers and the believers) is like the blind and the deaf (versus) the seeing and the hearing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:26: And surely, We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:27: That you worship none but Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:28: So the disbelieving chiefs and nobles of his people said: ‘You appear to us but a human like ourselves, and we have not seen any (honourable person) following you except the most inferior and lowest of (our society) having superficial opinion (who have become your followers without using discretion).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:29: Nuh (Noah) said: ‘O my people, what is your view: if I stick to a clear proof from my Lord and He has also granted me His (exceptional) mercy from Himself, but that has been veiled from you (like the blind), can we force it upon you coercively whilst you despise it?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:30: And, O my people, I do not (also) demand from you any wealth for (promoting and preaching this message).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:31: And, O my people, if I drive them away, then who will come to my help (to rescue me) from (the wrath of) Allah? Do you not reflect?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:32: And I do not say (this) to you: I have treasures of Allah (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:33: They said: ‘O Nuh (Noah), indeed you have disputed with us and disputed much.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:34: Nuh (Noah) said: ‘Allah alone will bring upon you that (torment) if He so wills and you cannot hinder (Him).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:35: And even if I resolve to counsel you, my counsel (too) will not benefit you if Allah wills to lead you astray.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:36: (O Glorious Messenger!) Do they say: ‘The Messenger has fabricated this (Qur’an) himself’? Say: ‘If I have fabricated it, then I shall have to bear (the resulting torment of) my sin.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:37: And it was revealed to Nuh (Noah): ‘None of your people will (now) believe (any more) except those who have (so far) believed.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:38: And build an Ark before Our Eyes in compliance with Our instructions, and do not converse with Me (about anything) pertaining to the wrongdoers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:39: And Nuh (Noah) set himself to building the Ark.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:40: So you will soon learn upon whom the torment comes (in the world) that will humiliate him and (then whom) the eternal torment befalls (in the Hereafter too).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:41: Until when Our command (of torment) came and the oven started gushing (like fountains, then) We said: ‘(O Nuh ,)
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:42: place aboard the Ark a pair of animals (male and female) of every species, and (take in) your family except those against whom the command (of destruction) has already gone forth, and whoever has believed (also take him with you).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:43: Nuh (Noah) said: ‘Get into the Ark; in the Name of Allah will it sail and anchor.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:44: And the Ark kept sailing, carrying them through (violent) waves towering like mountains.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:45: He said: ‘(Instead of embarking on the Ark) I shall just now take shelter on some mountain.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:46: (And when all were drowned and annihilated except Nuh’s

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:48: And Nuh (Noah) called out to his Lord and submitted: ‘O my Lord, indeed my son (too) was a part of my family, and certainly Your promise is true, and You are the Greatest of all rulers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:49: (Allah) said: ‘O Nuh (Noah), indeed he is not included in your family because his actions were not righteous.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:50: Nuh (Noah) submitted: ‘O my Lord, I seek refuge with You from asking You that of which I have no knowledge.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:51: He was commanded: ‘O Nuh (Noah), get down (from the Ark) with peace and blessings from Us on you and on the (kingdoms, classes and) species that are with you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:52: This (narration) is of the accounts of the unseen that We reveal to you.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:54: O my people! I do not demand of you any recompense for this (promotion and preaching of the message).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 11:55: And, O people, seek forgiveness of your Lord (for your sins), then turn towards Him (with true hearts).
